result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Guimarais Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Bond shall be applied towards the financial obligations.  Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim, Robert S.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Guimarais Jr

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  On a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss the citations in 15TR2838, 15TR2839, 15TR2840; Colloquy re: waiver of attorney, victim rights compliance; Defendant waives right to counsel, Court accepts waiver;   No contest plea entered;   Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, on motion of the state 15TR2838, 15TR2839, 15TR2840 are dismissed; Court reviews victim impact statement; Argument from State, defendant; Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Court previously allowed counsel to withdraw; def wishes to proceed pro se.  Def waives right to counsel; Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Multiple offers have been made.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Further pretrial held; no agreement reached.  Court has discussion w/def re proceeding pro se.  Def does not want stand-by counsel.  State plans on calling 11 witnesses.  Court orders by 3-24-17 each side to disclose any potential witnesses and what they will testify to; exchange with both parties and copy provided to Court - any witnesses not disclosed by this date will not be allowed to testify.  Court sets 3-day jury trial to begin 6-19-17.    The Court orders all motions, including motions in limine,  be filed on or before the jury status date.  Jury trial scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 30, 2017 at 10:00 am.
for Payment of Attorney Fees

Def in person & by Atty John A Best.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Court questions counsel.  Matter has not resolved.  Atty Best filed motion to withdraw, but proceeded w/filing of motions in limine due to deadlines.  Atty Best requests to withdraw.  Statements from def; def states he will try to retain private counsel.  Counsel also filed motion to extend deadlines; Court grants motion.  Court removes jury trial set to begin on 1-9-17.  Court does not allow Atty Best to withdraw - if def wants new counsel, he will have to privately retain.  Court adj status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
